skillTree.localised_description: Pugnacious and stubborn, the war beasts that pull these ramshackle chariots are grotesque combinations of great boar and mighty ram.

effects.description: Mount: Tuskgor Chariot

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Those strong enough to tame the powerful, unruly Razorgors can harness them for chariots.

effects.description: Mount: Razorgor Chariot

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Even when not feasting, the Beastmen taste blood on their lips, smell it on their fur, and want for more.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -15%
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice – a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +25%
Leadership: +5
Character's aura leadership effect: +5
Leadership aura size: +25%

skillTree.localised_description: A palpable miasma of fell sorcery surrounds the Bray-Shaman, distorting and maiming reality.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Distorted Reality"

skillTree.localised_description: Shamans do not generally engage in physical combat themselves, instead sending out their spirit to possess a suitably monstrous surrogate.

effects.description: Bound spell: "Savage Dominion"

ui_effects.localised_text: Summoned units have specific debuffs conditions

skillTree.localised_description: Bray-Shamans speak the will of the Dark Gods, and those that defy them pay the highest price of all.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

Winds of Magic cost: +15% for all enemy spells
	(enemy armies in province)

skillTree.localised_description: He knows. Nobody knows how, but he does. He has always just known.

effects.description: Spell resistance: 20%

skillTree.localised_description: Chaos smiles upon them, granting unnatural and heretical defence against mortal machinations.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Impenetrably matted fur and grim trinkets make the Bray-Shamans more than just vile to behold, but incredibly hard to injure.

effects.description: Armour: +15
Melee defence: +5

skillTree.localised_description: By the Bray-Shaman’s incantations, those lesser in body or mind have their hair and fur clogged into impervious hides.

effects.description:
Armour: +15 for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Cockatrice, Incarnate Elemental of Beasts, Ghorgon, Cygor, and Manticore units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: In the right hands the braystaff is not just a symbol of position or conduit of magic, but also a brutal weapon.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15%
Charge bonus: +15

skillTree.localised_description: In frenzied ritual celebration the Bray-Shaman invokes the Dark Gods’ power to infuse the herds with bestial strength.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +15% for Chaos Warhounds, Harpies, Razorgor Herd, Chaos Spawn, Giant, Jabberslythe, Cockatrice, Incarnate Elemental of Beasts, Ghorgon, Cygor and Manticore units
	(all units in army)
Ability: "Totem of Morrslieb"

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Cooldown: -30% to "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"

skillTree.localised_description: When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Smoke & Mirrors"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

effects.description: Spell: "The Penumbral Pendulum"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Spell: "Okkam's Mindrazor"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15%

skillTree.localised_description: The great green orb hangs ominously in the sky above, its followers driven to acts of madness and depravity.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A summons to war in which all are drawn into the cacophonous charge; glory or sanguine death is the prize.

skillTree.localised_description: "We feel it. We all feel it. The pull to war. The tug of battle. The NEED to kill."

effects.description: Ability: "Call of Violence"

skillTree.localised_description: The Beastman delights in constant fighting; in vicious, ceaseless brutality. It gives him purpose.

skillTree.localised_description: The Beastmen’s elite menagerie – the brayherds – slaughter all those caught in their savage, animalistic sights.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Only a select few from a herd gain their Beastlord's acknowledgement – a prize earned through the carnage and chaos they spread in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: In fitful dreams, he sees the end. The world collapsing in on itself, leaving nothing but ashes and aberration.

skillTree.localised_description: The ground shakes. The earth moves. The spirit trembles. The Beastman comes.

skillTree.localised_description: For those who face the warherd, a fate worse than death awaits their salivating jaws and unremitting bloodlust.
